page.title: 12SHIPSTON 40 YEARS AGO
page.content: The main change in the past 40 years has been to the size of Shipston-on- Stour.It has nearly doubled in size during that time. Many of the{houses}in 1945 had no inside toilets or taps.We know of none like this today. Few people owned{cars}in 1945,but gradually more people have bought them. Shipston-on-Stour had a{railway staion, but it was open for goods traffic only.It closed in 1960. There was also a cinema, but this closed in the 1950s and is now a motor showroom. When people went{shopping,}there was not such a variety of food or so much imported food as today.They could have cigarettes rolled for them and snuff was put into a cone-shaped bag.
